Package org.fluentjava.iterators

Package with iterators that are themselves iterables.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
ExtendedIterable<T> An Iterable that provides an extendedIterator instead of a Iterable.
ExtendedIterator<T> An iterator that is itself iterable.
 

Class Summary
AbstractExtendedIterator<T> ExtendedIterator that does the default behavior for iterator() and method: returns itself.
CompositeIterator<F,S> Iterator that takes two Iterators, Iterables, or Arrays (not necessarily both of the same type), and iterates through both, preserving the order.
CountingIterator<T> Extended Iterator Adapter that counts how many times next was invoked, mainly used to count the number of the iteration.
ExtendedIterableAdapter<T> Adapts an Iterable to a ExtendedIterable.
ExtendedIteratorAdapter<T> Adapter that adapts iterable's iterators, iterators (including extended iterators, making this a wrapper as well) and arrays.
LimitedIterator<T> Iterator that takes at most n elements of an adapted iterator.
 

Package org.fluentjava.iterators Description

Package with iterators that are themselves iterables.
